# Itty bitty micro-games

**Itty bitty** micro-games. Links that contain small games.

This list is a collection of some of the most unique Itty bitty micro-games creations. You can create a self-contained, shareable, Itty bitty micro-game without the need of a server! (so long as the micro-game can be [compressed](https://itty.bitty.site/#Link_) into about 2,048 bytes)

## What?

[Itty bitty](https://github.com/alcor/itty-bitty) is a nice experiment by [Nicholas Jitkoff](https://github.com/alcor)

With Itty Bitty the sites are contained entirely within their own link.

### URL fragment

The [URL fragment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fragment_identifier) that contains the micro-game is compressed using the Lempel–Ziv–Markov chain algorithm to reduces the size of the code. 

URL fragments (sometimes also called an anchor tag) have been used to automatically set the browser’s scroll position to a predefined location in the web page when the page it is loaded. The fragment is interpreted only by the local web browser, they are not sent to the server when requesting a website.

[How Itty Bitty works?](https://itty.bitty.site/#How_it_)
